intro: Distylium hondurense, commonly known as the Honduran distylium, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically have two distinct stamen types, a feature known as distyly. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
